result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation

2:41 PM Defendant Juan F Salinas Sr in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Juan F Salinas Sr.  Attorney Jessica Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Upon plea to Ct. 1 and 2 in 22CF375 and the State recommend consecutive prison in Ct. 1 and the length left to the court, On Ct. 2 the State would recommend concurrent time, length left to the court.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  CC used as a factual basis.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  State is in Chapter 950 compliance.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defense is asking for consecutive probation.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf. 
Plea:
22CF375:
Ct. 1- NC
Ct. 2- NC

BTC: 
22CF375:
Ct. 1- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1 yr. ES.  Consecutive to current sentence. 
Ct. 2- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1 yr. ES.  Concurrent to Ct. 1.  Consecutive to current sentence.  
Not eligible for CIP.  Eligible for SAP.  
22CF183:
Ct. 1- DRI
Ct. 2- DRI

Conditions:
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent, to include anger management. .  
Obtain and maintain full time employment. 
Comply with any child support ordered. 
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote.
